short_summary: Charter a fishing vessel for scientific research on Grand Banks of Newfoundland
description: To support Department of Fisheries and Oceans Canada (DFO) with conducting scientific research on Grand Banks of Newfoundland. The department is seeking the use of a fishing vessel with a minimum length of 20 m and which is certified to transport up to 12 persons, of which 8 persons are scientific staff, to carry out research related to biological studies, survey for marine habitat, and other assigned tasks related to DFO goals and objectives. Specifically, the vessel should be able to operate for periods of up to 30 days at a time and for a minimum of 150 days over the fiscal year, subject to weather conditions and availability of funding.

#### Tender Description

This Request for Proposal (RFP) is issued pursuant to the Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) Supply Arrangement (SA) #F6160-210004. The Department of Fisheries and Oceans Canada (DFO) is seeking to contract a fishing vessel of at least 65 feet (or larger) to conduct scientific research on the Grand Banks of Newfoundland. The research will include deployment and recovery of scientific instrumentation and oceanographic moorings. This requirement is subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA) and is not security-related.

Please review the attached tender documents for further information. If you are an interested supplier, please submit your proposal by the tender closing date. The tender proposal should be addressed to the Contracting Authority, as specified in the tender documents.
